GULAB JAMMUN 

 INGREDIENTS

 FOR JAMUN:
 1. ¾ cup (100 grams) milk powder, unsweetened
 2. ½ cup (60 grams) maida / plain flour
 3. ½ tsp baking powder
 4. 2 tbsp ghee / clarified butter
 5. milk, for kneading
 6. ghee or oil, for frying

 FOR SUGAR SYRUP:
 1. 2 cup sugar
 2. 2 cup water
 3. 2 cardamom
 4. ¼ tsp saffron / kesar
 5. 1 tsp lemon juice
 6. 1 tsp rose water

 HOW TO PREPARE

 1) Firstly, in a large bowl take ¾ cup milk powder, ½ cup maida and ½ tsp baking powder.
 2) Mix well, homemade gulab jamun mix is ready.
 3) Now add 2 tbsp ghee and mix well making the flour moist.
 4) Add milk as required start to combine.
 5) Combine well forming a soft dough. do not knead the dough. Cover and rest for 10 minutes.
 6) Meanwhile, prepare the sugar syrup by taking 2 cup sugar, 2 cup water, 2 cardamom and ¼ tsp saffron. Mix well and boil for 5 minutes or until the sugar syrup turns sticky. do not attain any string consistency.
 7) Turn off the flame and add 1 tsp lemon juice and 1 tsp rose water. lemon juice is added to prevent sugar syrup from crystallizing. Cover and keep the sugar syrup aside.
 8) After 10 minutes or resting the dough, start to prepare small ball sized jamuns. Make sure there are no cracks in the jamun.
 9) Deep fry in medium hot oil or ghee.
 10) Fry until the jamuns turn golden brown.
 11) Drain off and transfer the jamun into a hot sugar syrup. Cover and rest for 2 hours or until jamuns absorb the sugar syrup and doubles in size.
